Dialogue: Hear me? Cap'n? Some kinda compromise to the hull...holding for now, but...Goddamn, I'm glad you're alive. Gotta pull your E-release...no, red handle, red handle. I'll get the warm-ups out while --

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Why did I fall on you?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: He's dead. Cap'n's dead. Christ, I was looking right at him when --

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: I mean, I mean, chrono shows we're 22 weeks out, so gravity wasn't supposed to kick in for another 19. I mean, I mean, I mean, why did I fall at all?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: You hear me? Captain's dead. Owens too.

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Oh, no. Not Owens, not.... Wai', wai', wait. I'm Owens. Right?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Cryo-sleep. Swear to God, it sloughs brain cells.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: 1550 millibars, dropping 20 MB per minute, shit, we're hemorrhaging air. Somethin' took a swipe at us.

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Just tell me we're still in the shipping lane. Just show me all those stars, all those bright, beautiful, deep-space....

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Jesus God....

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: ... crisis program selected Number Two of this system because it shows at least some oxygen and more than 1,500 -- would you SHUT THE FUCK UP!  -- more than 1,500-millibars of pressure at surface-level. Okay, so maybe the ship did something right for a change....

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: ...showing no major water bodies...maximum terrain, 220 meters over mean surface... largely cinder and gypsum with some evaporite deposits....

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Fry? What're you doing?

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Fry?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Can't get my nose down...too much load back there....

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: You mean that "load" of passengers?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: So what, we should both go down too? Out of sheer fucking nobility?

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Look, Fry. Company says we're responsible for every one of those --

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Company's not here, is it?

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: When captain went down, you stepped up -- whether you like it or not. Now they train you for this, so --

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: And there wasn't a simulated cockroach alive within 50 clicks of the simulated crash site! That's how they train you! On a fucking simulator!

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Don't touch that switch!

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: I'm not dying for them.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Owens!

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: 70 seconds! You still got 70 seconds to level this beast out!

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Somethin' went wrong, huh?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: One chance and you blew it, Riddick. Never cease to disappoint me.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Hey, who?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Amazing. I'm Johns.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Carolyn Fry. I'd shake hands, but...

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Are there any others, Johns?

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Out, out, out, GET IT OUTTA ME!

Speaker: voices
Dialogue: Pull it out of him...No, it's too close to the heart...You gotta do it, just do it fast....

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Don't touch it! Don't touch that switch!

Speaker: voices
Dialogue: You'll kill him, I'm tellin' you, shit, just leave it alone...delirious...doncha you got some drugs for this poor man....

Speaker: owens
Dialogue: Don't touch that switch!

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Awright, awright, someone...there's Anestaphine in the med-lock, that end of the cabin...next to....

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Get away. Everybody.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Well. Our own little slice of heaven.

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Please...which way to New Mecca? We must know the direction in order to pray.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Big talk about a scouting party...

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Anyone else having breathing problems? Aside from me?

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Like I just ran, or something....

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: Feel one lung short. All of us.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Well, I tend toward the asthmatic. And with all this dust....

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: It's the atmosphere. Too much pressure, not enough oxygen. Might take a few days to --

Speaker: zeke
Dialogue: So what the bloody hell happened, anyways?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Somethin' knocked us off-lane. Maybe a rogue comet. Maybe we'll never know.

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: Well, I for one, am thoroughly fucking grateful. This beast wasn't made to land like this. But cripes, you rode it down.  C'mon, you lousy ingrates, only reason we're alive is a'cuzza her.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Liquid oxygen canisters inside. Start ripping them out. Quick hits only -- try to make it last.

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Well, is someone coming for us? Or are we all just gonna die of exposure or dehydration or sunstroke or maybe even something worse?  Hey, you don't have to worry about scaring me.

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: We're worried you'll scare us.  Name's "Audrey," right, love? And you're goin' to Taurus Three like we were?

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Yeah, but...do we even have enough food to get there? Or will we have to resort to cannibalism?

Speaker: zeke
Dialogue: I'll see 'bout makin' this air go a bit further, cap'n. With your permission, a' course.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: And him?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Big Evil?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: We just keep him locked up forever?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Be my choice. Already escaped once from the max-slam facility on --

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: I don't need his life story. Is he really that dangerous?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Only around humans.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Oh, Christ....

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Ask if anyone has anything in cargo! Anything to drink!

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Mine here....

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: S'matter?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Little swamp-flu from the Conga system. Never shook it with all this cryo-sleep.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: King Tut's tomb....

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Be surprised what these will fetch in the Taurus system. Here. This Wooten here -- easy, easy. Very rare.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: This is it? Booze? That's what you have to drink?

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: 200-year-old single-malt scotch is to "booze" as foie gras is to "duck guts."

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: A toast to whatever he just said.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: I'll need a receipt for that.  For all these.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Top of my list.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: I don't suppose....

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: One of the Christian habits we didn't adopt -- perhaps unfortunately. We'll have to wait.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: For what? There is no water. You understand that, don't you?

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: All deserts have water, somewhere. God shall lead us there.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Like we needed another way to die.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: What the hell are these?

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Maratha crow-bill war-picks from Northern India. Very rare.

Speaker: zeke
Dialogue: An' this?

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Blow-dart hunting stick from Papua New Guinea. Very very rare, since the tribe's extinct.

Speaker: zeke
Dialogue: 'Cuz they couldn't hunt shit with these things, be my guess.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Well, what's the need, anyway? If he's gone, he's gone. Why should he bother us?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: First, because he can only live out there for so long -- he's gonna come back and take what we got. Second, for the sheer thrill of the kill.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Imam. We should leave soon. Before nightfall but while it's cooler.

Speaker: zeke
Dialogue: What, you're goin' off, too?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Johns is leaving you a gun. Just do me a favor, huh? Get my crewies buried? They were good guys who died bad.

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: A'course we will.

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: My bloody oath....

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Three suns?

Speaker: zeke
Dialogue: So much for your nightfall.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: So much for my cocktail hour.

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: We take this to be a good sign -- a path, a direction from God.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: A very good sign.  That's Riddick's direction. You do not wanna be caught in the dark with this guy.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Thought you found his restraints over there. Toward sunset.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Which means he went toward sunrise.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: So quiet. You get used to the sounds of the ship, then....

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: You know who Muhammad was?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Some prophet guy?

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: "Some prophet guy." And a city man. But he had to travel to the desert -- where there was quiet -- to hear the words of God.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: You were on a pilgrimage? To New Mecca?

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Chrislam teaches that once in every lifetime should there be a great hajj -- a great pilgrimage. To know God, better, yes, but to know yourself as well.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Frightening thought.

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: We're all on the same hajj now.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Tell me it's not a mirage.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Trees?

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Amazing how you can do without the essentials of life -- so long as you have the luxuries.

Speaker: zeke
Dialogue: Well, just keep your bloody-fuckin' eyes open. Don't want that ratbag sneakin' up on me bloody-fuckin' arse.

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: He'd probably get you right here, right under the jaw. And you'd never hear him coming. That's how good Riddick is.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Now did you run away from your parents? Or did they run away from you?

Speaker: pilgrims
Dialogue: Allahu Akbar...Allahu Akbar....

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Is this whole planet dead?

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: He asks what could have killed so many great things...

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Some...communal graveyard, perhaps... like the elephants of Earth....

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Long time ago. Whatever happened.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Probably makes it worse. Dehydrates you even more.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Probably right.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Better keep moving....

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: What'd Owens mean? 'Bout not touching the switch?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Promise me. Swear to me you won't --

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: You see anybody else here? Just between you and me.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: During the landing...when things were at their worst...Owens was at his best. He's the one who wouldn't let the pilot dump the passenger cabin.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Hold up.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Thought he might be coolin' it in the boneyard -- could either double-back to the ship or slip in behind us. So I left the bottle out as bait.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Wait, wait, wait....

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: We are not alone here, yes?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Never thought we were.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Long gone. Whoever they were.

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Water...water there was here....

Speaker: pilgrims
Dialogue: Allahu Akbar....

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: "God is Great," yes?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: I'm born-again.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Lights.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Hey. Don't go too far, huh?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: No darkness. No lights because no darkness....

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Allahu Akbar!

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: This now qualifies as the worst fun I've ever had. Stop it.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Audrey? Oh, Audrey....

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Tell me that was you.

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Okay, it was me. What'd I do now?

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Assailing my fragile sense of security, that's what.

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: What're you goin' on about? She's been right here for the last....

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: Zeke?

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: total stranger
Dialogue: I thought...my God, I thought I was the only one who....

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Oh, Lord....

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: It was just somebody else. From the crash. He was just....

Speaker: zeke
Dialogue: Cripes galore, I thought it was him. The murderin' ratbag. I thought he was....

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: No juice, looks like it's been laid up for years. But we might be able to adapt --

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Shut up.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Like what?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Like my pistola.

Speaker: zeke
Dialogue: Now what the bloody hell....

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Same crap, different planet, huh?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: ...I don't play that...I don't play that so just try again. C'mon, Riddick, tell me a better lie....

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Ease up, ease up. JOHNS! Just tell me what....

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: What'd you do with 'im? You bloody sick animal you, what'dja do with me Zeke?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: He used that?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Sir Shiv-a-lot. He likes to cut.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: So why isn't it all bloody?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: I assume he licked it clean.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: So where is he?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Tell me about the sounds. You told them you heard something right before....  If you don't talk to me, Johns'll take another crack at it -- at your skull.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: 'Mean the whispers?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: What whispers?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: The ones tellin' me to go for the sweet spot -- just to the left of the spine, fourth lumbar down. The abdominal aorta. What a gusher. Had a cup on his belt, so I used it to catch a little run-off. Metallic taste to it, human blood. Coppery. But if you cut it with peppermint schnapps, that goes away. Course, that's more for winter. Summertime, I take mine straight.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Why don't we try the truth now?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: All you people are so scared of me -- an' most days, I'd take that as a compliment -- but it ain't me you gotta worry about now.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Show me your eyes.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Show me, Riddick.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: You did this? To yourself?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Slam doctor. Well, we called him "doctor."

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Heard about it. Just never seen it.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Fairly fuckin' ironic, wouldn't you say? Slamlight's so dim that you go and get your eyeballs taken out and shined up -- then you wind up here. Three ass-kick suns.  Maybe I did do a few people. But not this one. No ma'am, not this time.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Then where is he? He's not in the hole. We looked.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Look deeper.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: I know what happened -- he went off on the guy, buried him on the hill somewhere, and now he's trying to --

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Let's just be sure.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: I am sure. Look, murders aside, Riddick belongs in the Asshole Hall of Fame. He loves the jaw-jackin', loves making you afraid, 'cuz that's all he has. And you're playing right into --

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: We're gonna find the body, Johns. Christ, you're a cop. Why am I tellin' you this? We gotta go down and find it.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Well, don't ask me to.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Thought you didn't believe his story.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: I don't. But that ground looked none too stable, and I don't want anyone --

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: If you're afraid, I'll go.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Nobody else is going down but me, okay?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Hey. Bein' ballsy with your life now doesn't change what came before -- it's just stupid.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: What, you think I'm doin' this to prove something?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: You said it, not me. Let's just not let one bad call lead to another.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Thanks for the tip, Johns.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: They're hollow....

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Here! I'm in HERE, HERE, HERE!

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Did you hear....

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: I'm over here in the --

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Oh, God....

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: We got you...it's okay, it's okay...we got you now....

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: The child heard you before any of us could even....

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: Did you find him? You find Zeke?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: ...wasn't Riddick...it was...it was... goddamn, that was stupid....but wasn't Riddick. Somethin' else down there that got Zeke and nearly got --

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: One is all?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: For now.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Found somethin' worse than me, huh?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: We're movin'. And I'm just wondering if I shouldn't lighten the load right now.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Woof, woof.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Want you to remember this moment, Riddick. The way it coulda gone and didn't.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Say that again.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Here's the deal. You work without the chains, without the bit -- without the shivs. You help us get off this rock....

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: For what? The honor of goin' back to some asshole of a cell?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Truth is, Riddick, I'm tired of this head-up shit. I wanna be free of you as much as you wanna be free of me.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: You'd cut me loose, Boss?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Only if we both get outta this alive. And there may be a way.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: My recommendation: Do me. Don't take the chance that I'll get shiv-happy on your wannabe ass. Ghost me, Riddick. Would if I were you.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: If you were me, I'd kill us both. C'mon, you wanna sit at the grown-up table or not?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Want you to remember this moment.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: So just like that. Wave your little wand and he's one of us now.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Didn't say that. But least this way I don't have to worry about falling asleep and not wakin' up.

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Well, I feel we owe Mr. Riddick amends.

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: Oh, right. Let's all line up and beg his forgiveness. Right you are.

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: At least give the man some oxygen....

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: He's happy just bein' vertical. Leave him be.

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: So I can talk to him now?

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Paris P. Ogilvie. Antiquities dealer, entrepreneur.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Richard B. Riddick. Escaped convict, murderer.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: You know, if I owned Hell and this planet...I believe I'd rent this out and live in Hell.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: I mean, usually I can appreciate antiques, but, uh....

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Little ratty-ass.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Nothing we can't repair -- so long as the electrical adapts.

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: Not a star-jumper.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Doesn't need to be. Use this to get back up to the Sol-Track Shipping Lanes, stick out a thumb. You'll get picked up.  Right?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Little help here?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Check those containers for me. See what we can patch wings with.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Okay, that should buy us a sys-check. But we'll need more cells.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: How many?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: 15 6-gigs here...90 gigs total...other ship carries 20-gig cells, so...five. Five total to launch.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: 25 kilos each, huh?

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: Old sand-cat outside. See if I can't get it up and chuggin'.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Do it. And if you need an extra hand, tap our problem child out....  Where's Riddick?

Speaker: robot
Dialogue: "...to all intruders. I am the guardian of this land. I will protect my masters at all cost. Death to all intruders..."

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Missin' the party. C'mon.

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: ...and for this, our gift of drink, we give thanks in the name of our Prophet, Muhammad, peace be upon him, and to our Lord, Jesus Christ of Nazareth, and to his father, Allah the Compassionate and the Merciful.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: The strangest religion....

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Perhaps we should toast our hosts. Who were these people, anyway? Miners?

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: Looks like geologists. Advance team, moves around from rock to rock.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Musta crapped out here, huh?

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: But why did they leave their ship?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Well, just a skiff. Disposable, really.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Like an emergency life-raft, right?

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: Sure. Coulda had a real drop-ship take them off-planet. Long gone.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: A toast to their ghosts, then....

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Didn't leave, these people. Whatever got Zeke got them. They're all dead.

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: Maybe they had weight limits, you don't know.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: I know you don't uncrate your emergency ship unless there's a fucking emergency.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Rag it, Riddick. Nobody wants your theories on --

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: So what happened? Where are they, then?

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Has anyone seen the young one? Ali?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Has anyone checked the coring room?

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Ali....

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Ali?

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: Why was the door chained up? Why the bloody hell would they lock themselves in like that?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Not sure, but tell you what: Chrislams better not be diggin' another grave out there.

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: So that's what come of me Zeke. An' you saw it. You was right there.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Though I notice he tried to ghost my ass. When he shot up that stranger instead.

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: Take it.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: What, it's broken?

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: Startin' to acclimate, anyhow. Take it.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Let's board this up and get the hell gone. They seem to stick to the dark, so if we stick to daylight, should be all --

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: 60 years ago.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Wha'?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Core-samples are dated. Last one is 60 years ago. This month.

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: Yeah? What's special about that?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Dunno. Maybe nothing, but....

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Are you fuckin' kidding me?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Not afraid of the dark, are you?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: ...need those cells from the crash ship. Shit, still gotta check out the hull, patch the wings --

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Let's wait on the power cells.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Wait for what? Until it's so dark we can't even find our way back to --

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: We're not sure when it happens, so let's not --

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Get the fucking cells over here, Johns. What's the discussion?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Ever tell you how Riddick escaped?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: He can pilot?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Hijacked a prison transport, made a helluva good run 'fore I tracked him down.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Okay, maybe that's a good thing. Maybe I can use him to help with --

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: He also figured out how to kill the pilot, Fry.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: You said we were going to trust him now. You said there was a deal.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: That's what I said.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Oh, this is a dangerous game you're playing, Johns.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: May've noticed chains don't work on this guy. Only way we're truly safe is if he believes he's goin' free. But if he stops believin' --

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: You mean, if he learns that you're gonna royally fuck him over.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: You know, he hasn't harmed any of us. Far as I can tell, he hasn't even lied to us. Just stick to the deal, Johns. Let him go if that's what it --

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: He's a murderer. The law says he's gotta do his bid.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Dancin' on razor blades here...

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: I won't give him a chance to grab another ship -- or to slash another pilot's throat.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Bad sign. Shakin' like that in this heat.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: I'll cut.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: They're coming.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Strange, not doin' a run-up on the main drive yet.  Strange unless he told you the particulars of my escape.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: I got the quick-and-ugly version.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: An' now you're worried about a repeat of history?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Entered our minds.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: I asked what you thought.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: You scare me, Riddick. That's what you wanna hear, isn't it? There, I admit it, Can I get back to work now?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Think Johns is an do-right man? You think I can trust him to cut me loose?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Why, what'd you hear?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Well, guess if it was trickeration he'd just do me, huh? Then again...I am worth twice as much alive.  Didn't know? Johns ain't a cop. Oh, he's got that shiny badge an' all, but nah -- he's just a merc and I'm just a payday. That's why he won't kill me. The creed is greed.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Save it, Riddick. We aren't gonna turn on each other -- no matter how hard you try.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: I don't truly know what's gonna happen when the lights go out, Carolyn -- but I do know that once the dyin' starts, this little psycho family of ours is gonna rip itself apart. So you better find out the truth. Come nightfall, you better know exactly who's standing behind you.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Oh, ask him 'bout those shakes. And ask why your crew-pal had to scream like that 'fore he died.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: I never said I was.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Never said you were a hype, either.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: You have a little caffeine in the morning, I have a little morphine. So what?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: And here you got two mornings every day. Wow, were you born lucky?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Not a problem unless you're gonna make --

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: You made it a problem when you let Owens die like that. When you had enough drugs to knock out a fucking mule-team.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Owens was already dead. His brain just hadn't caught on to that fact.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Anything else we should know about you, Johns? Christ, here I am lettin' you play games with our lives when --

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: My first run-in with Riddick. Went for the sweet-spot and missed. They had to leave a piece of the shiv in there. I can feel it, sometimes, pressing against the cord.  So maybe the care and feeding of my nerve-endings is my business.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: You coulda helped. And you didn't.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Yeah, well, look to thine own ass first. Right, "captain"?

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: What do my eyes see?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: It's starting....

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: If we need anything from the crash ship -- I suggest we kick on. That sand-cat's solar.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: LET'S GET THOSE CELLS!

Speaker: shazza
Dialogue: We stay together! C'mon!

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Don't wanna miss this.

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Lookit. Lookit!

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Don't stop, don't stop....

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Jesus, how many can there....

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Just a suggestion, but perhaps we should flee.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Cargo hold, everyone in the cargo hold. lesgo, lesgo, lesgo.

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Tell her to stay there. Stay down. SHAZZA, JUST STAY DOWN!

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: No, no, NO, NO, NO....

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: What is it? What's happening?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Like I said. Ain't me you gotta worry about.

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: What if...what if she's still out there... still alive....

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Well, I don't want to jump to conclusions here...but 'member that boneyard? These just might be the fuckers that killed every other living thing on this planet, okay? Chances of Shazza knockin' on that door anytime soon are just about zero squared.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: I saw the cut-marks on the bones. Wasn't a natural die-off.

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Quiet, please. Everyone.

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Why do they do that? Make that sound?

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Perhaps the way they see. With sound, reflecting back.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Echo-location. That's what it is....

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Breach in the hull. I dunno.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: I'd rather piss glass.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Well, you got the big gauge.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Wanna rag your fat mouth?

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Maybe it's just their beads again. Imam, are you still --

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: No, no, no, I do not believe --

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: C'mon, man, you're drivin' everybody bugfuck with those things. Why don't you just lose the goddamn....

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Big beads.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Okay. We're okay. Just some small ones that musta --

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Very big beads.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Not staying in here another....

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Christ, you don't know what's out there!

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: I know what's in here!

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Everybody come, this way and we should be safe. Hurry, please....

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Can you do sumpin' else with that? 'Sides holding it in my fucking face?

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Hello, hello?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Don't. Move.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Imam? Where are they?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Stop it, stop it, STOP IT!

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: 'Sokay, 'sokay. I killed it.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: There....

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Like the light is scalding it.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: It hurts them. Light actually hurts them....

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Is that...Hasan?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: We'll burn a candle for him later. C'mon.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: ...one cutting torch...one handlight here, two more in the cabin...I think two more....

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Spirits. Anything over 45 proof burns well.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: How many bottles?

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Not sure. Ten?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Those umbrellas, the ones that mist. Would they burn?  If you got a receipt?

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Possibly.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Awright. So maybe we'll have enough light.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Enough for what?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: We can stick to the plan. If we get four cells back to the skiff, we're off this rock.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: I hate to kill a beautiful theory with an ugly fact, but that sand-cat won't run at night.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: We'll have to carry the cells...drag them...whatever it takes.

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: You mean...tonight? With all those things still out there?

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Oh, sure. Why not? Sounds like a hoot.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Back it up. How long can this last? Few minutes? Couple hours?

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: I had the impression...from the model... that the two planets were moving as one. That there would be...a lasting darkness.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Those suns gotta come back sometime. And if these animals really are phobic about light, we just sit tight till then.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: I'm sure that's what someone else said. Locked inside that coring room.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Look, we gotta think about everyone now -- the kid especially. How scared is she gonna be out there?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Oh, don't use her like that, for a smoke screen.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Smoke screen for what?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: For your own fear.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Hey. Why don't you rag your hole for two seconds and let someone else come up with a plan that doesn't involve MASS SUICIDE?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: How much you weigh, Johns?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: What the hell's it matter?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: How much?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: 79 kilos.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Because you're 79 kilos of gutless white meat, and that's why you can't come up with a better plan.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Think about that reward, Johns.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: I'm willing to take a cut in pay.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: How 'bout a cut in your gut?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Oh, Trash Baby, you're gonna regret this.

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Please...this solves nothing...please....

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: They're afraid of our light. That means we don't have to be so afraid of them.

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: And you're certain you can find the way back? Even in the dark?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: No, I'm not. But he can.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Riddick.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Looks clear.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Fuck me. You said "clear."

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Said "looks clear."

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Well, what's it look like now?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Looks clear.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Just get the goddamn lights on....

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Ready, Johns.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: He'll lead you over the first cliff. You know that, don't you?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: We're just burnin' light here.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: You give him the cells and the ship -- and he will leave you. He will leave you all out there to die.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: I don't get it, Johns. What is so goddamn valuable in your life that you're worried about losing? Huh? Is there anything at all? Besides your next hype?  Got no right to be so scared. Neither one of us.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Keep the light going. That's all we have to do to live through this. Just keep your light burning.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Be runnin' about 10 paces ahead. I want light on my back -- but not in my eyes. And check your cuts. These things know our blood now.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Riddick...was thinkin' we should make some kind of deal. Just in case, you know, this actually --

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Had it with deals.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: But I just wanted to say --

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Nobody's gonna turn a murderer loose. I fuckin' knew better.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: We can, can't we? Trust you?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Actually...  That's what I been askin' myself.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: So you noticed too?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Riddick. Riddick.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Where are the sand-cat tracks? Why aren't we still following them?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Saw something I didn't like.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Such as.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Hard to tell, sometimes...even for me... but looked like a bunch of those big boys chewin' each other's gonads off. Thought we'd swing wide. Okay by you?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Let's move.  Just a detour. He'll get us there.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Can we switch?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: What, switch what?

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: I think I twisted my ankle running backwards like that. And I'm not sure I can....  Okay, that's a lie. I just don't want to be alone back there anymore. If you could just give me a few minutes up front here --

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: She's the pilot, she should stay close to the cells.

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Oh, so I'm disposable?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: I'll switch, I'll switch! Christ, just get this train moving!

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Light, please, need light here....

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Please...have we been cut? Can someone tell me if....

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Oh, sweet Jesus....

Speaker: paris
Dialogue: Oh, sweet Jesus, WILL YOU GET ME SOME LIGHT OVER HERE!

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: What do you see? Riddick?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Hunger. I see 60 years of hunger.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Bottle-count.

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Four fulls, one half. That mean we're halfway there? I hope?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Can we pick up the pace?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: We aren't completely stupid.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Stay in the light! Everybody! Stay in the fucking --

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: We crossed our own tracks.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: He's running us 'round in circles. Look for yourself. Look!

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Riddick? What the hell are you --

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Listen.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Canyon ahead. I circled once to buy some time to think.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Think about what?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: About how to kill us and still get these cells to the skiff. Goddamnit, we're just doin' the heavy lifting for this prick!

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: About the girl.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: What about her?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: What it's gonna be like when we hit that canyon. With her bleeding.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: What're you jaw-jackin' about? Girl's not cut.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: No. She's not.

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: I didn't want you to leave me there... back at the ship...that's why I didn't say anything....

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: No, we'd never....Oh, God, honey, you shoulda told me sooner.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Aw, this can't be happening to me....

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: They been nose-open for her ever since we left. They go off blood.

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Well...we must keep her close, then. Here, she'll be safe if we put her between --

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: There is no "safe."

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: It's not gonna work. We gotta go back.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Hey, you're the one who got me out here, turned me into a goddamn sled dog. An' now you 'spect me to go back like a whipped dog?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: I was wrong. I admit it. My bad, okay? Now let's just go back to the ship.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: I dunno. Nice breeze, wide open spaces -- you know, I'm startin' to enjoy myself out here.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Are you fucking high again? Just listen to --

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: No, no, you're right, Fry. What's to be afraid of? My life is a steamin' pile of meaningless toadshit anyhow. So I say mush on! Canyon's only couple hundred meters, after that we're in Skiff City! So why don't you just butch up, stuff a cork in that kid, and get --

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: She's the captain, we should listen to --

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Listen to her? Her? When she was willing to sacrifice us all?

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: What's he talkin' about?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: During the crash, she --

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: This does not help us, Johns.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: -- she tried to blow the whole fucking passenger cabin, tried to kill us --

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Just shut up, okay?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: -- tried to kill us in our sleep. Paris had it right -- we are disposable. We're just walking ghosts to her.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Would you RAG YOUR STUPID HOLE!

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: We're not alive because of her -- we're alive in spite of her.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: We cannot go through there....

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: How much you weigh right now, Fry? Huh?

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Fine, fine, you've made your point. We can all be so scared as you.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Verdict's in. The light moves forward.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Ain't all of us gonna make it.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Just realized that, huh?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Six of us left. If we could get through that canyon and lose just one, that'd be quite a fucking feat, huh? A good thing, right?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Not if I'm the one.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: What if you're one of five?

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: What're they doin' up there?

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Talking about the canyon, I suppose. How to get us through.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Look, it's hellified stuff -- but no different than those battlefield doctors when they have to decide who lives and who dies. It's called "triage," okay?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Kept calling it "murder" when I did it.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Either way, figure it's something you can grab onto.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Sacrifice play. Hack up one body, leave it at start of the canyon. Like a bucket of chum.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Trawl with it. There's a cable on the sled. We can drag the body behind us.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Nice embellishment.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Don't wanna feed these land-sharks -- just keep 'em off our scent.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: So which one caught your eye?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Don' look, don' look, don' look....

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Imam. Slow down.

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Don't stop, just slow down.  Little more space 'tween us and them.

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: I would rather we all stay--

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Do what I say. Please.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: What's her name, anyway?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: What do you care?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Then let's not name the Thanksgiving turkey, okay? I assume you still got a shiv.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: What, you 'spect me to do it?

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: What's one more to you? Like this is the one that sends you to Hell?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Oh, you're a piece of art, Johns. They oughtta hang you in a museum somewhere. Or forget the museum -- maybe they should just hang you.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Awright. You do the girl, I'll keep the others off your back.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Just wonderin' if we don't need a bigger piece of chum.

Speaker: johns
Dialogue: Like who, Mr. Chrislam?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Bring the light!

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: What're they doing? What're we --

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Leave the sled, let's go, go, go!

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Gotta stay in the light, Johns. That's the only rule.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Remember that moment?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Shoulda never took the chains off, Johns. You were one brave fuck, before. Now look at you. Oh, yeah, you were Billy Bad-ass with your gauge...with your chains....

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Back to the ship, huh?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Get out of our way.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: So everybody huddles together till the lights burn out? Until you can't see what's eating you? That the big plan?

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Where's Mr. Johns?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Which half?

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: You mean....

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Gonna lose everybody out here....

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: He died fast. And if we got any choice, that's the way we should all go out.  Don't you cry for Johns. Don't you dare.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: How many you see?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: One or two.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Audrey?

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Three full bottles. But almost time to refill.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Doesn't seem like enough to turn back on, does it?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Only see one way. Turn the sled over and drag it like that, girl down low. Light up everything we got -- and run through like dogs on fire.

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: The sled as a shield....

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: And what about the cells?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: I'll take those.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: We're just here to carry your light, aren't we? Just the torch-bearers.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Let's drop back an' boot up.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: What're you doin'?

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Blessing you like the others.  It's painless.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: And pointless.

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: I see. Well, even if you don't believe in God, it doesn't mean He won't be --

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: You don't see.

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: He will be with us. Nonetheless.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Give my blessing to the girl. She needs a spare.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: As fast as you can.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: You sure you can keep --

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: As fast as you can.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Don't look.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Do not look up.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Keep going, keep going, keep going, keep going!

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: "So dark the clouds around my way I cannot see, But through the darkness I believe God leadeth me. I gladly place my hand in His when all is dim, And, closing my weary eyes, lean hard on him...."

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Riddick? RIDDICK?

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: What? What is it?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: It's a fucking staircase! Go over it! GO OVER IT!

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Audrey!

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Didn't know who he was fuckin' with.

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Suleiman!

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Get the girl back under. Keep going.

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: SULEIMAN!

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: KEEP GOING OR I WILL!

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Oh, no. No, no, no....

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Rain.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: So where the hell's God now, huh?  I'll tell you where! He's up there PISSING ON ME!

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Riddick? How close?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Tell me the settlement is right there! RIDDICK, PLEASE!

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: We can't make it.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Here...hide here....

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Inside...inside....

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Why's he still out there?

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: He's not coming back, is he?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: There's light in here.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: What are they?

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Larva....

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Glow worms....

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: How many bottles we got? Empty ones?

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: More, more, we need more....

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Strong survival instinct. Admire that in a woman.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: You're not leaving. Not until we go back for the others.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Think you've mistaken me for somebody who gives a fuck.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: What, you're afraid?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Confusin' me with Johns now -- fear was his monkey. I only deal in life and death. All that stuff in between? Some shade of grey my eyes don't see.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: I trusted you, Riddick. Goddamn, I trusted that some part of you wanted to rejoin the human race.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Truthfully? I wouldn't know how.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Then wait for me. I'll go back myself. Just give me more light for them.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Just come with me!

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Got a better idea. Come with me.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: You're fuckin' with me. I know you are.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: 'Course I am -- but doesn't mean I won't leave you here. If you believe anything about me, better be that.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: No, you see, I promised them...I have to...I have to go and....

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Step aboard, Carolyn.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: I can't....I can't....

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Here. Make it easy on you.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Don't do this to me....

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Just give me your hand.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: But they...they could still be....

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: No one's gonna blame you. C'mon. Take my hand and save yourself, Carolyn.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: I will not give up on them! I Will not leave anyone on this rock with those fucking things, even if it means --

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: You'd die for them?

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: I would try for them.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: You barely know them.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: But I'm human. I know you view that as a weakness, but I'm sorry -- I do feel fear, theirs too. Goddamnit, Riddick -- yes. I would die for them.

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: You came for us....

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah -- we're all fuckin' amazed. Anyone not ready for this?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Tighter, tighter....

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Stop.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: I don't hear --

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Doesn't see us...wait for it to leave....

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Get behind me.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: When I go, we go. Full-throttle.

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Ready...ready....

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: You know the way!

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: Captain....

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: It's me, it's me, it's me!

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: C'mon, Riddick -- said I'd die for them, not you.

Speaker: fry
Dialogue: Just 10 steps...keep turning, keep turning...that's right...others're already 'board, waitin' for us right now...five steps...c'mon, almost there, Riddick... almost there...we're almost --

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Not for me....

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Probably okay to talk to me now.

Speaker: audrey
Dialogue: Not sure where to go. I was just runnin' away when this whole thing started.  Where you goin'?

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Not sure. I was just runnin' away when this whole thing....

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Might interest you....

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: New Mecca....

Speaker: riddick
Dialogue: Think a soul could get lost there? With all those pilgrim-types?

Speaker: imam
Dialogue: It's more a place where souls are found, Mr. Riddick.
